explanation_composer.regulatory_rule_cue:
Traffic Separation Scheme (TSS) applicability in the Øresund Strait; spatial anchor near København (DK) – Oslo (N) corridor
Operational Protocol Rationale: Vessels in this region, particularly tankers without hazardous cargo, commonly maintain stable speed and follow predictable, nearly straight trajectories to comply with structured maritime traffic lanes. The consistent alignment between course over ground and heading, along with minimal fluctuations in speed and direction, reflects disciplined transit behavior typical of regulated zones where collision avoidance and route adherence are prioritized. This pattern rules out anchoring, maneuvering, or erratic motion, which would show variable speed or abrupt course changes.
